intro: Chionochloa defracta, commonly known as the alpine hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is a perennial grass that thrives in cold, high-altitude environments, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. The plant has slender, hair-like leaves that are adapted to withstand harsh weather conditions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. Chionochloa defracta plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for alpine wildlife.
